result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon R. Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 2 and Ct 3 in this same case as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified, but is consecutive to any other sentence out there

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.
No contact with the Victim unless the Victim and the Agent approve in writing, exception would be third party contact to make arrangements for for child visitation/placement.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request   Defendant is to undergo Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is stayed pending further Court Order

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon R. Tatum
Current: Stanley Correctional, 100 Corrections Drive, Stanley, WI 54768 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 661, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States

11:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brandon R. Tatum in court, in custody from Stanley Correctional..  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Brandon R. Tatum. Defendant pleas no contest. Rights given. Court finds that he has entered his plea knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant guilty.  Victim also present.  Sentencing comments
Letter from Orenda Center, victim has completed safety planning

Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Waived reading of Information  The Defendant Entered a plea of not guilty.

08:54 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Brandon R. Tatum, appeared by video from Dodge Correctional with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court.    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint.    Preliminary hearing waived.    The Court finds that the defendant has waived his right to a preliminary hearing, intelligently, knowingly and of his own free will and accepts the waiver, finds probable cause and binds the case over for further proceedings.  Waiver was filed.     Defendant waives his in person appearance and has no objection to appearing remotely.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on April 26, 2022 at 08:50 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon R. Tatum
Current: Dodge Correctional Institution, PO Box 661, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: N14303 CTH D, Owen, WI 54460

09:39 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Brandon R. Tatum,did not appear, he was sent to Dodge this morning, Attorney Christine Kuczynski, who appeared in person in the courtroom.  JA to arrange a hearing with Dodge.
